page.title: 10Wheatley Hill - Rock Farm
page.content: Rock farm was built in 1648. It is three hundred and thirty seven years old. It was called {Rock Farm}because it was built from local stone. In all it covers over {400}acres which is quite large for this area. The main work of the farm is in dairy farming. Thirty two people are emplyed to work with a large herd of Fresian cows. Unlike many dairy farms who supply their milk direct to a wholesale dairy, Rock Farm has its own plant for pasteurising and bottling the milk. To cope with modern feeding methods and production techniques, the farm has installed a computer to record all details of dairy production. This has led to savings in feedstuffs and correct feeding has led to increases in milk yields.
